title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Functional Biliary Sphincter of Oddi Disorder (SOD)
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Functional Biliary Sphincter of Oddi Disorder provides criteria for diagnosis of functional biliary sphincter of oddi disorder.

orgreference.text: Cotton PB, Elta GH, Carter CR, Pasricha PJ, Corazziari ES. Rome IV. Gallbladder and Sphincter of Oddi Disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016;150:1420-1429.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for biliary sphincter of Oddi disorder, patient must have the following:

  1. Criteria for biliary pain.
  2. Elevated liver enzymes OR dilated bile duct, but not both.
  3. Absence of bile duct stones or other structural abnormalities.

Supportive criteria:

  1. Normal amylase/lipase.
  2. Abnormal sphincter of Oddi manometry.
  3. Hepatobiliary scintigraphy.
